Actions are what your character chooses to do during each turn of combat.
You have to buy actions before you can use them, but once you buy them, you have them forever!
Click on an action\'s name for information about it. Click on an action\'s lock to unlock/relock it.
As you level up your classes, you\'ll gain access to more and more actions. If you don\'t see any actions on this page, that means there are no new ones to buy.
All actions have requirements, including a cost in Skill Points. If you meet all the requirements for an action (not including the cost), it will appear on this page.
Be sure to save at the bottom when you\'re done!
Here you can view actions as they will appear in-game!
Distribute skill points among various classes to unlock actions, items, perks, and increase their general effectiveness!
Click a class\'s name for more information about it.
The early levels of a class will unlock their basics, so branching out is very useful even if you only invest a little.
Every X levels in a class will unlock a new action (items and perks are unlocked sporadically). The level cap is 100.
Be sure to save at the bottom when you\'re done!
You\'ll earn skill points after each battle, and even more if you win!
Spend skill points on various skills such as classes, items, perks, and stats.
Once you create your character, you\'ll be given 100 Skill Points to use on them in the Customize menu.
To switch who your current character is, use the menu in the top right. This menu is not available while creating a new character.
Click on the left to play against the computer 1 on 1 or in a number of simulated scenarios.
Click on the right to play with a friend 1 on 1 on this device. You will both choose from your existing characters.
This is a list of all games the current character started. Click on one to continue it, or if there aren\'t any, start a new one!
Perks help make your character stronger by giving them special abilities or improving upon the abilities they already have!
You have to buy a perk before you can use it. After you buy one, it will become active, and you can deactivate/reactivate it at any time (except in battle).
Click on a perk\'s name for information about it. Click on a perk\'s checkbox to activate/deactivate it.
You can have as many perks active at once as you want!
Be sure to save when you\'re done.
Click on a perk\'s name for information about it. Click on a perk\'s lock to unlock/relock it.
As you level up your classes, you\'ll gain access to more and more perks. If you don\'t see any perks on this page, that means there are no new ones to buy.
All perks have requirements, including a cost in Skill Points. If you meet all the requirements for a perk (not including the cost), it will appear on this page.
All perks have positive and negative effects, balancing them out.
Be sure to save at the bottom when you\'re done!
Each stat governs a different resource for your character.
Some classes use a particular stat more than others (an elemental is likely to use a lot of mana, while a warrior will use way more stamina), but each class depends on all stats eventually.
Be sure to save when you\'re done!
Player 1 is the character starting the game. If you want to change who it is, do so by changing the current character.
Player 2 can be any character, even the same one as player 1!
Be sure to pick a meaningful name; it is how you will find this game to continue playing later.
The terrain can greatly affect how a battle plays out. Try choosing one that is fair for both characters.
At the end of the turn limit, whoever has the most health wins. Picking none will make this battle a fight to the death!
This is the main menu. Remember that the back button in the bottom left can be used to get back here from just about anywhere.

On the other hand, the back button in the top left (not shown on the main menu) will bring you to the previous screen you were on. Think of the top left arrow as a small jump back, while the bottom left arrow is a big jump back!
Additionally the menu in the top right can be used to change your current character or create a new one. This can be done from Any menu, but cannot be done while you\'re in a game.
If you\'re ever stuck or confused, click the title of a page for some tips!
You have no character! Before you do anything, you have to create one in the menu in the top right corner.
This will delete your character permanently. Are you sure you want to do this?
Please enter a name for your new game!

The warrior class specializes in melee combat. Warriors are proficient in a number of weapons such as swords, axes, and hammers. They are also well trained in the usage of shields and numerous close-combat maneuvers.

The magician class specializes in, well, magic. The magic they can perform ranged from hypnotizing a crowd with their magical watch to pulling a gun out of a hat. They are tricksters and show offs, the source of their power entirely unknown.

The elemental class specializes in spellcasting. Elementals are capable of controlling the 4 basic elements (earth, air, fire, and water) and are known for their temper. While they are very powerful, it takes them take a little longer to use their mystic powers.

The mad doctor class specializes in the human anatomy. A full-fledged MD can heal even the most grievous of injuries, and even a novice can perform first aid in an a mere second. In addition to healing the body, MDs are also proficient in destroying and/or modifying it.

The marksman class specializes in ranged combat. Marksmen are capable of using long-range weapons such as bows and slings (and even guns if they are engineers). They also have impeccable sight, allowing them to see details others may overlook.

The acrobat class specializes in movement. Acrobats can move around in their environment with ease, allowing them to dodge and outmaneuver their opponents. They can even make precisely calculated movements to achieve feats such as catching an arrow.
The ninja class specializes in ninjutsu. Ninja are able to sneak and take their opponent by surprise, create traps throughout their environment, and use all manner of deception, including illusions.

The engineer class specializes in building. Engineers can use material they store in their inventory or even things they find in their environment to create a number of tools and gadgets. These include things such as bombs, machinery, and cross-class utilities.
